result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:53 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Brandon C Konichek.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson states he was notified only minutes ago that def is in Portage Co. Jail -status is undetermined at this time, requests continuance to attempt resolution
Atty. Steiner agrees to continuance

Court states given her schedule she would like to schedule jury trial at this time, and set another status date.
Court requests any substantive type motions should be filed by next Jury status hearing.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
10:45 AM Defendant Brandon C Konichek appeared by video, in custody in Sauk County Jail.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Brandon C Konichek.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard. Filed a form of substitution. Ready to proceed with the arraignment. 

Attorney Ericson waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.

Court will approve the substitution and will not schedule anything until a new Judge is assigned.

9:29 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Brandon C Konichek appeared by video audio, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Brandon C Konichek.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard. Ready to proceed with the preliminary hearing. 

1W - Detective Ashely Erickson, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Erickson
No redirect by Attorney Steiner

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Erickson waives any argument and objects to bind over. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Attorney Steiner is heard and will file the information. 
Attorney Erickson requests another day for an arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon C Konichek
Current: 1300 Lange Court, c/o Sauk County Jail, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2022)
Prior: 1407 SOUTH 1ST STREET, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821
Defendant shall have no contact with NND.

9:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Brandon C Konichek appeared by video audio, in custody in the Sauk County Jail.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Brandon C Konichek.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $5,000.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with NND. 

Atty Erickson is heard on bond. Requests a signature bond and or low cash bond. 

Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with NND. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson

2:29 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Brandon C Konichek not in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

DA requests a warrant. 
Court issues a warrant and to be held for further bond hearing.
